main event: A civilian in Yonkers, New York, reported a ground-visual observation of a round, brilliant white object, larger than any star in the sky, which appeared for approximately 20 seconds and then faded out. The object appeared to move in a southerly direction at an unknown speed, with no sound heard.
interesting points: The object was described as round and brilliant white, larger than any star in the sky.
There was no sound associated with the sighting.
The possibility of an after-burner equipped aircraft like F-94, F-95, etc., was considered due to the brevity of the sighting, the brilliant white color of the object, and the fade-out.
